oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of a patriotic sign mounted on a corrugated metal building wall
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A photgraph of a young man standing beside two signs mounted on a corrugated metal building wall. The upper sign is hand made and reads "AMERICA/ FIRST/ RIGHT OR WRONG/TO HELL WITH THE KAISER." The lower sign appears to be professionally painted with the business name "Crown's / KELLY AND CO." The photograph was owned by Sgt. Gus A. Wood, Jr., Batry. B, 114th F.A. Regt., 30th Div. The 114th served in France and fought at St. Mihiel and the Argonne Forest. Batry. B was recruited in Chattanooga, Tennessee.
